timeline.bodyText: Are we sure about using a method reference here?
timeline.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
why not? It's typically preferreable over a lambda - although in this case (since my other changes made it stateless) it should be comparable.
I generally highly prefer method references, as there is no possible mistake about the lambda possibly becoming a stateful lambda, which requires extra memory, a proxy, and extra overhead to track the proxy. A method handle will never unintentionally capture state, so it helps to fight such hidden costs.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: It doesn't capture state, but it's still implemented via invokedynamic, isn't it?
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I know it should not make any real world difference and the cost will probably be dominated by the slowness of computeIfAbsent, just trying to cover all bases because we are talking about a core component :)
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: yes but invokedynamic isn't a performance problem? Capturing state lambdas and anonymous Function classes are far worse
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText:
BTW I thought this was straight forward, but if there's concerns I don't mind removing this specific commit. It's not that important :)
I do care more about some of the other commits in this PR though, so I'd prefer removing this change if it expedites the others.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: Right, if it were me, I'd remove it, but I'm not hell bent on it
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
Is there a reason why you don't apply your trick of trying to get the value first before calling computeIfAbsent? Or is it a case where you have a good change for it to not be in the map?
You told me about it a long time ago and it had quite a few benefits in HV.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: yea good idea, we could have done that as well I guess. I didn't jump to it as this whole block doesn't seem highly concurrent - call me conservative, but @geoand still got scared :)
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText:
BTW I also wonder why do we care for protection domains... return a singleton and disable all this stuff 🗡️
But I don't know the consequences well enough.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: In this specific case, that should work as there is ever only one RunnerClassLoader, so the JarResource could indeed be passed the ClassLoader that it helps "populate" (perhaps by adding an init method to ClassLoadingResource) and then this block would just class getProtectionDomain which would just return the singleton.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I can make that change when this lands
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message: Character replacements in String are better off by passing a char
Adding a toString method to JarResource greatly helps debugging
Remove never thrown IOException from signature
